translation.ja: 〝ペンシルベニア大学 ウォートン校〞 同級生は皆 目標を見据えていたが 同級生は皆 目標を見据えていたが 同級生は皆 目標を見据えていたが ＡＮＤ１共同創業者 セス･バーガー

translation.en: 'cause it'll be a lot more fun to do any business with your best friend.

translation.en: Tom has a 3.96 GPA at Wharton undergrad.

translation.en: I'm like, "How's that possible?" "Like, the dude's playing basketball seven hours a day."

translation.en: And he said, "Just so you're aware, Tom's kind of a strange cat."
translation.ja: トムは少々 変わり者だった

translation.en: He's, like, you know, looking down, not making eye contact, talking real low.
translation.ja: うつむいて目を合わせず 小さな声で話す うつむいて目を合わせず 小さな声で話す ＡＮＤ１共同創業者 トム･オースティン

translation.en: But Tom was brilliant. And he was really the genius behind AND1.
translation.ja: だが 頭がよく AND1の陰のブレインだった

translation.en: [Tom] I grew up in small towns in New England.
translation.ja: 〝メーン州の 緑を守ろう〞 ニューイングランド地方の 小さな町で育った

translation.en: We moved, like, three times.
translation.ja: ニューイングランド地方の 小さな町で育った

translation.en: I was a shy, quiet kid, and basketball was the thing that let me connect with people.
translation.ja: 内気な子供だったが バスケでは人と関われた

translation.en: [Seth] So, I talked to Tom, and I'm like,
translation.ja: そこでトムを誘った

translation.en: "Yo, man. Um, you might be interested in pursuing a basketball business?" "What are you doing next year?"
translation.ja: “バスケブランドの会社に 興味はないか”と

translation.en: [Tom] I had no professional skills. I had only held very low jobs. You know, dishwasher, busboy.
translation.ja: 当時 専門スキルもなく 皿洗いや雑用の仕事をしてた

translation.en: So when I heard they were working on a basketball startup, that was a lifeline for me, right?
translation.ja: 起業は夢をかなえる チャンスだ

translation.en: 'Cause I just wanted to stay connected to the game, and I wanted to wear shorts to work. [laughs]
translation.ja: バスケと関わりながら 短パンで働ける

translation.en: [Jay] We had the meeting at a pizza parlor,

translation.en: and we were trying to figure out what's the identity of the brand that we would bring.
translation.ja: ブランドアイデンティティを 検討した

translation.en: When you make a bucket, and you get fouled, 'cause you know the basket is going in, you say, "And one."
translation.ja: ファウルされたシュートが 入れば“アンドワン(フリースロー１本)”を得る

translation.en: You don't say, "And one," you scream, "And one."
translation.ja: “アンドワン”と叫ぶんだ

translation.en: -That's the ultimate way to talk shit. -It's like, "And one, motherfucker!"
translation.ja: 悪態もつく “ザマ見ろ”

translation.en: [Tom] And then I had this idea. We can put trash talking on a T-shirt.
translation.ja: そこでトラッシュトークの Ｔシャツを作るため

translation.en: So I wrote up 30 slogans, and I was like, "This is our first shirt."
translation.ja: そこでトラッシュトークの Ｔシャツを作るため 30個のフレーズ考えた

translation.en: "I'm sorry I thought you could play." "I'm the bus driver. I take everyone to school."
translation.ja: 〝お前のプレーは残念〞 〝勝つのは俺だ〞

translation.en: "Wear a collar. You just got dogged." Probably the most famous one, which is, "Your game is as ugly as your girl."
translation.ja: “負け犬は首輪をしろ” “お前の女より醜い試合だ”

translation.ja: 生まれて初めて考えた トラッシュトークだ

translation.en: But it was really the culmination of 15 years of playing all the time.
translation.ja: でも15年間のバスケ経験が 役立った

translation.en: [Tom] So when we started with AND1, we didn't know how merchandising worked,
translation.ja: １９９５年 起業当初は—— 物品販売の仕組みを 何も知らなかった

translation.en: how retail worked. We didn't know anything.

translation.en: So we were creating our own culture, and sometimes that was a beautiful thing,

translation.en: and sometimes it was Lord of the Flies.

translation.en: Two Wharton degrees and a Stanford degree, and we're selling T-shirts out of the back of a hatchback.
translation.ja: 名門大卒の３人が 車でＴシャツを売った

translation.en: The first year we lost money.

translation.en: But I remember the feeling of someone saying, "I wanna pay you for your shirts." I was like, "Wow."

translation.en: And people loved the trash-talking shirts.

translation.en: So we felt like, you know, we might have something here.
translation.ja: トラッシュトークに 可能性を感じた頃—— 〝俺は お前の心臓を えぐる外科医〞 〝俺のガードに ならないよう祈れ〞 フットロッカーが 商品を置いてくれた

translation.en: And then we ended up getting an order for three or four styles from Foot Locker.

translation.en: The other stores see kids walking around with our shirts, and they're calling us.

translation.en: Turning into some big business for a T-shirt company.

translation.en: This kind of fashion, not the kind of thing you see every day,

translation.en: but they're on to something.

translation.en: Come on. We wanna do it, don't we?
translation.ja: 〝負けを認めて帰れ〞 お前もやるだろ？ お前もやるだろ？ お前もやるだろ？ 「フレンズ」 １９９５年

translation.en: Well, I was looking forward to playing basketball,
translation.ja: 「フレンズ」 １９９５年 「フレンズ」 １９９５年 僕はバスケがしたいが 無理そうだ 僕はバスケがしたいが 無理そうだ

translation.en: but I guess that's out the window.

translation.en: [Tom] Within that first year,
translation.ja: 〝クサいやつは 近寄るな〞 〝クサいやつは 近寄るな〞 初年の売上は 160万ドルだった

translation.en: we ended up doing about 1.6 million in sales.

translation.en: Then the challenge becomes, "Okay. What's next though?"

translation.en: We knew we wanted to be a billion-dollar company.
translation.ja: 〝成功と向き合う時〞 10億ドル規模を目指す

translation.en: So from day one, we were competing with only one brand.

translation.en: Just do it!

translation.en: Here we have the, uh, the new, improved Air Jordan.

translation.en: We want to make the number one basketball brand in the world. We can't do that unless we do shoes.

translation.en: [Tom] That's where the money was at, and Nike had that whole market on lockdown.

translation.en: [reporter 1] High-tech shoes and slick ads get more and more sophisticated.
translation.ja: シューズも広告も 洗練されていきます

translation.en: Nike is just doing it.

translation.en: [reporter 2] Fourth-quarter profits improves to 126 million dollars.
translation.ja: 〝収益が急増〞 第４四半期の利益は １億2600万ドル 第４四半期の利益は １億2600万ドル 第４四半期の利益は １億2600万ドル 〝純利益は31％増〞

translation.en: [man] When you bring the right athlete with the right advertising,
translation.ja: 最適な選手と広告を 採用すれば

translation.en: it creates a very strong situation in the marketplace.
translation.ja: 市場に確かな地位を 築くことができる

translation.en: So now, we need to go and get our own Michael Jordan.
translation.ja: 僕らも契約選手が要る

translation.en: We couldn't start with B-level guys.

translation.en: -[announcer] Marbury behind the back to… -[whistle blows]

translation.en: There's no "ifs" for Stephon Marbury from Georgia Tech.

translation.en: He says he's ready to move on and rub shoulders with Magic and Michael.

translation.en: Everyone in basketball knew Steph. He was an electric basketball player.

translation.en: With the fourth pick in the 1996 NBA Draft,
translation.ja: 1996年 ＮＢＡドラフト４位

translation.en: the Milwaukee Bucks select Stephon Marbury from Georgia Tech University.
translation.ja: ミルウォーキー･ バックスの指名 ジョージア工科大学の ステフォン･マーブリー

translation.en: [reporter] This man is a can't miss.
translation.ja: 注目の選手です

translation.en: [Seth] We effectively bet the company on Steph.
translation.ja: 彼に会社の命運を賭けた

translation.en: We said, "We want you to be a ten-year endorsement deal,"
translation.ja: 10年間のスポンサー契約だ

translation.en: which is unheard of for a kid who had never played a minute
translation.ja: 10年間のスポンサー契約だ プロ未経験の選手では 前代未聞だった

translation.en: of professional basketball.
translation.ja: プロ未経験の選手では 前代未聞だった

translation.en: [announcer] From Georgia Tech, number 3, Stephon Marbury!
translation.ja: ジョージア工科大学 背番号３ ジョージア工科大学 背番号３ １９９７年 １９９７年 １９９７年 ステフォン･マーブリー ステフォン･マーブリー

translation.en: [Jay] For opening night, myself and Seth are literally courtside, and we're so excited.
translation.ja: 僕らは開幕戦のコート横で 心を躍らせていた

translation.en: The shoes are hitting the water, coming into Foot Locker. The TV ads are running.
translation.ja: シューズは発売間近で テレビＣＭも打ってる

translation.en: Who knew that all we'd been building was gonna go up in smoke that night.

translation.en: I can still see it. Steph goes up, and I'm like, "uh-oh."

translation.en: [announcer] Oh my goodness.
translation.ja: 大変です

translation.en: I just broke out in a cold sweat seeing that.
translation.ja: 見るからに痛そうです

translation.en: Our faces are white.
translation.ja: 僕らは顔面蒼白(そうはく)だ

translation.en: [Seth] Oh my God. We just ran a "breaking ankles" TV campaign for Stephon Marbury.
translation.ja: うちの新製品を履いた “最新の足”を宣伝し

translation.en: And Stephon just broke his ankle wearing our shoes.
translation.ja: その足をケガした

translation.en: A week before the shoes are supposed to hit.
translation.ja: 発売の１週間前にだ

translation.en: [announcer] Stephon Marbury being helped off the floor…

translation.en: [Stephon] I usually recover real quickly, but being that this is a bit more severe,
translation.ja: いつもより 回復に時間がかかる

translation.en: I'm really hurting, you know, knowing that I can't play.
translation.ja: プレーできなくて つらい

translation.en: [Jay] And so, we're in the tunnel,
translation.ja: 世間に見放され

translation.en: and we see Steph's agent looking at us with just, like, daggers in his eyes.
translation.ja: マーブリーの代理人には 鋭い目でニラまれた

translation.en: [Seth] Someone on his team says,
translation.ja: 誰かに言われた

translation.en: "I might have Stephon go on national TV and dump your shoes in the garbage can."
translation.ja: “お前らのシューズを テレビ番組で捨ててやる”と

translation.en: And I literally just said, "Bro, it's been real, but I think we're done."
translation.ja: 〝終わった〞と思ったよ 〝終わった〞と思ったよ 〝マーブリーが負傷〞 〝ＡＮＤ１は 試練のスタート〞 解決策が 何も見つからなかった

translation.en: "I can't figure out any way we're not gonna go broke right here."
translation.ja: 〝ＡＮＤ１は 試練のスタート〞 解決策が 何も見つからなかった 解決策が 何も見つからなかった 解決策が 何も見つからなかった 〝ＡＮＤ１が失敗〞

translation.en: [Jay] We wanted to play the endorsement game, wanted to out-Nike Nike, and we failed.
translation.ja: ナイキを越えようとして 失敗した 〝再起不能 ナイキにはなれない〞

translation.en: Two weeks later, we got this tape. It had been around our office.
translation.ja: その２週間後 オフィスでビデオを見た

translation.en: There were a couple of interns, and they were always watching it.
translation.ja: インターン生が いつも見ていたやつだ

translation.en: [Jay] The video blew our minds.
translation.ja: その映像に衝撃を受けた ニューヨーク市 ラッカーパーク

translation.en: [Seth] I was like, "Holy shit."
translation.ja: “マジかよ”

translation.en: I've seen a lot of basketball. [chuckling] I've never seen this before.
translation.ja: “バスケは知ってるが これは初めてだ”とね

translation.en: [Tom] And in this game was 15-year-old Rafer Alston,
translation.ja: 映っていたのは 15歳の レイファー･アルストン

translation.en: who was called "Skip 2 My Lou."
translation.ja: スキップ･トゥ･マイ･ルーだ

translation.en: [announcer] Show some love for my homeboy,
translation.ja: スキップ･トゥ･マイ･ルーに 盛大な拍手を！

translation.en: Skip 2 My Lou!
translation.ja: スキップ･トゥ･マイ･ルーに 盛大な拍手を！ スキップ･トゥ･マイ･ルーに 盛大な拍手を！ スキップ･ トゥ･マイ･ルー

translation.en: [Skip 2 My Lou] New York streetball style,
translation.ja: スキップ･ トゥ･マイ･ルー スキップ･ トゥ･マイ･ルー ニューヨークスタイルは 想像力を使う ニューヨークスタイルは 想像力を使う

translation.en: it's a style where you just let your imagination flow.
translation.ja: ニューヨークスタイルは 想像力を使う レイファー･アルストン

translation.en: [Skip 2 My Lou] It was more poetry in motion. It was more trickery and sorcery.
translation.ja: 詩的な動きと 魔法のようなトリックで

translation.en: I always wanted to deceive you.
translation.ja: 見る人を惑わす

translation.en: A third of what he's doing is illegal right here.
translation.ja: ３割がルール違反だ

translation.en: But I don't really think it matters because it's so unique.
translation.ja: だが独特なら ルールは重要じゃない

translation.en: Streetball is hip-hop,
translation.ja: ストリートボールは ヒップホップとグラフィティ

translation.en: graffiti, breakdancing,
translation.ja: ストリートボールは ヒップホップとグラフィティ ブレイクダンスの融合だ

translation.en: all-in-one.
translation.ja: ブレイクダンスの融合だ

translation.en: And the crowd is our music.
translation.ja: 歓声は俺たちの音楽になる

translation.en: Winning has nothing to do with streetball.
translation.ja: 勝つことに意味はない

translation.en: [Skip 2 My Lou] Your team, they could lose, but if you've electrified the crowd, they were satisfied. [chuckling]
translation.ja: 観客を刺激できれば 負けても満足なんだ

translation.en: [The Main Event] The court is the canvas. The style of play that you have is your ink.
translation.ja: コートはキャンバスで プレースタイルはインク

translation.en: And the player that you is is the artist.
translation.ja: プレーヤーはアーティストだ

translation.en: A lot of us come up through the inner city in single-parent homes.
translation.ja: 俺たちの多くは 片親でスラム地区育ちだ

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] My mom had me when she was 15.
translation.ja: ドリブルマシン／ シェイン･ウォニー ドリブルマシン／ シェイン･ウォニー 母は15歳で俺を産み

translation.en: I grew up in one of the biggest projects in the Bronx.
translation.ja: ブロンクスの 公団住宅で育てた

translation.en: I never really had a steady home to practice my skills.
translation.ja: 練習に打ち込める 家庭じゃなかった

translation.en: It wasn't about sports, it was about survival.
translation.ja: バスケはサバイバルだ

translation.en: The first time I touched a basketball, I probably was maybe 11, 12?
translation.ja: 初めてボールを触ったのは 11～12歳の頃だ 初めてボールを触ったのは 11～12歳の頃だ メインイベント／ ワリー･ディクソン

translation.en: Just didn't really have the basketball skills or basketball IQ.
translation.ja: バスケのスキルや 知識はなかったが

translation.en: But my dad would take me out to different parks, and that's where I honed a lot of my skills.
translation.ja: あちこちの公園に 父親と行って教わった

translation.en: Streetball, it's a way of life here.
translation.ja: 暮らしの一部だ

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] It wasn't about money. Because that was the NBA.
translation.ja: ＮＢＡとは違い カネは要らない

translation.en: [announcer] Swish picks up Dumars, who lets it fly, and he hits it again for three!
translation.ja: デュマースがシュート 再び３点だ

translation.en: [The Main Event] Where we came from,
translation.ja: 地元では 多くの人が

translation.en: a lot of people don't have that type of money
translation.ja: 地元では 多くの人が ＮＢＡ観戦に行くカネを 持ってない

translation.en: to go see an NBA game at the Madison Square Garden.
translation.ja: ＮＢＡ観戦に行くカネを 持ってない

translation.en: So for us, Rucker was the main stage in New York City.
translation.ja: だからラッカーパークに 集まった

translation.en: Streetball was born there.
translation.ja: ストリートボールの発祥地だ

translation.en: When they first took me to watch a game, I was little and skinny.
translation.ja: 初めて見たのは子供の頃で

translation.en: I made my way to the front, and I just sat right there on the court. I'm watching my idols play.
translation.ja: 最前列に座らせてもらい 憧れの選手たちを見てた

translation.en: Pee Wee Kirkland, Joe Hammond, Earl Manigault,
translation.ja: ピーウィー･カークランド ジョー･ハモンド アール･マニゴールト ドクター･ジェイ

translation.en: Dr. J.
translation.ja: アール･マニゴールト ドクター･ジェイ

translation.en: People that were seven, eight blocks away, you could hear them. You knew where everyone was at.
translation.ja: ７～８ブロック先にいても 歓声が聞こえるんだ

translation.en: Most people at some point realized, "I might not make D1. I might not make the NBA."
translation.ja: Ｄ１やＮＢＡの夢に破れても

translation.en: But you can still go play at the playground.
translation.ja: 公園ではプレーできる

translation.en: So I realized what's on this tape. It's just pure, like, self-expression.
translation.ja: ビデオに映っていたのは 純粋な自己表現だ

translation.en: And that's when I started to understand this is the essence of who we are.
translation.ja: それがAND1の本質なんだ

translation.en: We're playground. We're grassroots. We're everyman basketball.
translation.ja: 公園のコートで 一般人がバスケをして

translation.en: We're attitude, we're raw expression, we're art.
translation.ja: 悪態をつき 感情をむき出しにする

translation.en: And this is a strategic position that Nike can't touch.
translation.ja: ナイキには手が出せない

translation.en: [reporter] We interrupt this program to bring you the following Special Report.
translation.ja: 番組を中断して 特報をお届けします

translation.en: [anchor] Good morning and thank you for joining us.
translation.ja: おはようございます

translation.en: It's the day Bulls fans around the world have been dreading for years.
translation.ja: 本日 ブルズファンは 悲しみに暮れるでしょう

translation.en: Michael Jordan is scheduled to make a big announcement at the United Center any minute now.
translation.ja: マイケル･ジョーダンが 重大発表を行います

translation.en: I am here to… to announce my retirement from the game of basketball.
translation.ja: ここに引退を表明します

translation.en: [Jay] Now, all of a sudden, with Jordan being out
translation.ja: 〝Ａ級選手の引退〞 ジョーダンが引退し

translation.en: and there being no games on because of the NBA lockout,
translation.ja: 〝Ａ級選手の引退〞 ＮＢＡロックアウトで 試合もない ＮＢＡロックアウトで 試合もない

translation.en: there was a void in the basketball market.
translation.ja: 市場に空白ができた

translation.en: There was this opportunity for new content that didn't exist before.
translation.ja: 新しいものを 導入するチャンスだ

translation.en: [Jay] As a business, how can we take that experience of a streetball game at the Rucker
translation.ja: ラッカーパークで培った ストリート経験を生かし

translation.en: and make it something that actually fills that void?
translation.ja: その穴を埋めたかった

translation.en: One of the young guys that we had hired to do product placement in New York,
translation.ja: ニューヨークでの宣伝に 雇ったのが——

translation.en: a guy named Set Free, who was a DJ, producer, hip-hop artist.
translation.ja: ＤＪでプロデューサーの セットフリーだ

translation.en: He says, "We should make that a mixtape and just give it away."
translation.ja: 彼が“ミックステープを作り 配布しよう”と提案した

translation.en: It ended up being this collection of footage plus unreleased music.
translation.ja: 〝スキップ･ トゥ･マイ･ループ〞 〝スキップ･ トゥ･マイ･ループ〞 プレーの映像と未発表音楽を １本にまとめたビデオだ プレーの映像と未発表音楽を １本にまとめたビデオだ

translation.en: This is Sway from the World Famous Wake Up Show, and y'all are about to view the AND1 Mixtape on video.
translation.ja: 今日はAND1の ミックステープを紹介する

translation.en: Coming to you live. Keep it banging!
translation.ja: 生放送だ　見逃すな

translation.en: AND1 pressed 50,000 old-school VHS tapes.
translation.ja: ５万本のビデオを制作し——

translation.en: We gave away through the street teams, clubs, courts, neighborhood barbershops.
translation.ja: クラブやバスケコート 理髪店などで配布した

translation.en: And it was like the new crack. It went rampant in the inner city.
translation.ja: 麻薬のように 街じゅうに広まった

translation.en: [Tom] Each person sharing it with another dozen or two dozen or three dozen people.
translation.ja: １本のビデオが 数十人でシェアされる

translation.en: We had this insane viral marketing in the pre-internet age. [chuckling]
translation.ja: ネット前時代だが 映像が拡散した

translation.en: After Mixtape came out, I was like a hero in New York City.
translation.ja: ビデオが出ると 俺は一躍有名人だ

translation.en: Before I know it, I have 20 people walking behind me. "Oh man, Skip. I wanna walk with you. Can I walk inside the park with you?"
translation.ja: 背後には行列ができた “一緒に歩かせてくれ”とね

translation.en: [Sway] Look out for Volume 2, y'all! AND1 Mixtape!
translation.ja: ２作目が待ちきれない！

translation.en: By Monday, we had calls coming in from people who had lost their minds.
translation.ja: 週明けには興奮した人々が 電話をかけてきた

translation.en: We all gathered around the phone, just listening to all these messages.
translation.ja: みんなで留守電を聞いたよ みんなで留守電を聞いたよ 〝音声メッセージ〞

translation.en: -[beeps] -[man] Yo, that mixtape was sick.
translation.ja: 〝音声メッセージ〞 〝音声メッセージ〞 イカしてたぜ

translation.en: [man 2] Killed it, AND1!
translation.ja: 最高だ！

translation.en: [man 3] Skip 2 My Lou!
translation.ja: スキップ･トゥ･マイ･ルー！

translation.en: [man 4] Hold on.
translation.ja: ウソだろ

translation.en: [man 5] Need another one, please!
translation.ja: 次も頼むよ

translation.en: -[man 6] Where is Volume 2? -[beeps]
translation.ja: ２作目はまだか？

translation.en: Immediately the question was, "How do we do another one?"
translation.ja: ２作目のテーマに——

translation.en: So we created the idea for the AND1 Mixtape Tour.
translation.ja: 〝ＡＮＤ１ ミックステープツアー〞 ミックステープツアーを 企画した

translation.en: We're gonna put together the best playground pickup basketball team we can.
translation.ja: ＡＮＤ１の 選抜チームを編成し 〝スキップ･ トゥ･マイ･ルー〞 ＡＮＤ１の 選抜チームを編成し ＡＮＤ１の 選抜チームを編成し 〝メインイベント〞 ＡＮＤ１の 選抜チームを編成し ＡＮＤ１の 選抜チームを編成し 〝ハーフマン･ ハーフアメイジング〞

translation.en: Get your best five, and we have our best five
translation.ja: 〝ハーフマン･ ハーフアメイジング〞 〝ハーフマン･ ハーフアメイジング〞 地域の選手５人と 対戦する 地域の選手５人と 対戦する 地域の選手５人と 対戦する 〝ヘッドエイク〞

translation.en: and let's put on a game.
translation.ja: 地域の選手５人と 対戦する 地域の選手５人と 対戦する 〝シェイン〞 〝シェイン〞

translation.en: But let's not just do it one time in New York.
translation.ja: それを１都市でなく いくつかの都市でやる 〝ニューヨーク州〞 それを１都市でなく いくつかの都市でやる それを１都市でなく いくつかの都市でやる 〝ニュージャージー州／ ペンシルベニア州〞

translation.en: Let's start going city to city.
translation.ja: それを１都市でなく いくつかの都市でやる 〝ニュージャージー州／ ペンシルベニア州〞 それを１都市でなく いくつかの都市でやる それを１都市でなく いくつかの都市でやる 〝ワシントンＤＣ／ ジョージア州〞

translation.en: [man] I was brought on at AND1 as a tour manager and headed up Player Relations.
translation.ja: 地方の選手を集めるために AND1に雇われた

translation.en: The idea was, "Hey. We're just gonna do this five-city tour."
translation.ja: 目的は５都市を巡り ツアーマネージャー クリス･ハイタワー

translation.en: Really to get content for more mixtapes.
translation.ja: ２作目の映像を 撮ることだ

translation.en: [announcer] Shane!
translation.ja: シェイン！

translation.en: [The Main Event] I just got kicked out of Rutgers University 'cause of my grades.
translation.ja: ちょうど大学を中退し

translation.en: Now I'm back at home. My son was four or five. You know, I needed a job.
translation.ja: 幼い息子を養うために 仕事を探してた

translation.en: [The Main Event] I get a call from AND1.
translation.ja: AND1から連絡があった

translation.en: "Yo, you think you'll pull a game off in your hometown?"
translation.ja: 〝ストリートは最高〞 “地元選手を集めてくれ” “地元選手を集めてくれ” “地元選手を集めてくれ” 〝ＡＮＤ１が ツアーを主催〞

translation.en: First phone call I made was Shane.
translation.ja: シェインは外せない

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] Playing streetball, but it's in my thirties,
translation.ja: ストリート現役だが30代だ

translation.en: and the NBA was far-fetched for me.
translation.ja: ＮＢＡは遠い夢だった

translation.en: I'll never forget. I'm standing on the corner, and Main calls me.
translation.ja: その頃 メインイベントから 電話があった

translation.en: And it was going through one end out the other end. The only thing that really caught my attention was,
translation.ja: 適当に聞いてたが この言葉に心引かれた

translation.en: "AND1's gonna give us free sneakers, free shorts to bust some dude's ass? Let's do it."
translation.ja: “AND1がスニーカーと Ｔシャツをくれるぞ”

translation.en: [Duke] Welcome, ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls. My name is Duke Tango.
translation.ja: お待たせしました デューク･タンゴです デューク･タンゴ／ トーマス･ミルズ

translation.en: And sit back and relax because this is how we roll.
translation.ja: くつろいでご覧ください

translation.en: Duke Tango's the godfather announcer of streetball.
translation.ja: ストリート実況の創始者だ

translation.en: If Duke Tango gave you your name,
translation.ja: 彼に通称をもらったら

translation.en: he's solidifying who you are as that streetballer.
translation.ja: 選手としての地位が固まる

translation.en: Main said, "Yo, would you like to be involved with this?"
translation.ja: メインイベントに誘われた

translation.en: And I looked at him like, "Who would say no to that?"
translation.ja: 断るわけがない

translation.en: When you see that crowd around the corner, and then you walk into that park and see thousands of people?
translation.ja: 行列を横目に公園に入ると 数千人が集まってた

translation.en: Ain't no way in the world you can be prepared for that.
translation.ja: 心の準備はできない

translation.en: Well, I say, "Yo, Main and Shane, let's go to Philadelphia and get AO."
translation.ja: ２人に提案した “ＡＯを誘おう”

translation.en: "Let's get this Headache." Then I got Black Widow,
translation.ja: ヘッドエイクと ブラックウィドウ

translation.en: and Half Man Half Amazing.
translation.ja: ハーフマン･ ハーフアメイジングもだ

translation.en: And so, AND1 did the first-ever contracts with streetball players.
translation.ja: ストリート選手との契約は 業界初だ

translation.en: [Tom] The first stop is Linden, New Jersey.
translation.ja: まずは ニュージャージー州

translation.en: We brought the camera crew to film both crowd and game.
translation.ja: 観客と選手の両方を撮影した

translation.en: I don't even think I really knew what filmmaking was back then.
translation.ja: 当時の俺に 撮影の知識はなかった 当時の俺に 撮影の知識はなかった ジー･ロック／ Ａ(アラステア)･クリストファー

translation.en: I just knew I had a camera in my hand, and I'm bringing the audience with me.
translation.ja: ただカメラを持ち 見る人のために撮った

translation.en: I just tried to capture everything that I felt and everything that I saw because it was unbelievable.
translation.ja: 見たもの感じたものを 記録しようと努めただけだ

translation.en: [The Main Event] This is Chris Hightower's itinerary.
translation.ja: 〝ニュージャージー州 リンデン〞 ツアー日程だ

translation.en: -[Gee Lock] This is a Hightower original? -Official.
translation.ja: すごい 公式だ

translation.en: [Chris] When I went on tour. they gave me a corporate car, six grand in cash, and was like, "Make it work."
translation.ja: ツアーでは社用車と 現金６千ドルが与えられた

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] We stayed in shit hotels. We shared rooms.
translation.ja: 最初は格安ホテルの 相部屋で——

translation.en: We're playing in front of a crowd of 100 people.
translation.ja: 観客は100人ほどだった

translation.en: And now I'm in a minivan sitting in the chair from the house that's sliding all over in the van.
translation.ja: 車は座席をスライドさせる ミニバンだ

translation.en: [Chris] We were our own street team.
translation.ja: 自分たちのチームだ

translation.en: Boxes of tapes, we're passing them out, passing out flyers,
translation.ja: 大量のビデオと チラシを配り

translation.en: trying to do every and anything we could to get people to the event.
translation.ja: 会場に観客を集めようと 努力した 会場に観客を集めようと 努力した 〝フィラデルフィア〞

translation.en: We didn't know where it was gonna go. There was no blueprint. And it was really just all about having a platform
translation.ja: 先は見えなかったが 活躍の場がそこにあった

translation.en: for players like ourselves, who didn't make it to the NBA,
translation.ja: ＮＢＡを諦めた選手たちが プレーで稼げる場だ

translation.en: to get paid to play.
translation.ja: ＮＢＡを諦めた選手たちが プレーで稼げる場だ ＮＢＡを諦めた選手たちが プレーで稼げる場だ 〝ワシントンＤＣ〞

translation.en: [Jay] So every year we go to one of those big trade shows. We're running these videos outside of our booth.
translation.ja: トレードショーで ミックステープを流すと

translation.en: There's a massive crowd, and they're coming to watch Volume 2.
translation.ja: ２作目を見ようと 大勢が集まってきた

translation.en: We knew at that moment that there was something here
translation.ja: その時 気づいたんだ

translation.en: that could be much bigger than we thought, much faster than we thought.
translation.ja: もっと早く 大きくできると

translation.en: Hot 97.5 ATL's original hip-hop and R&B station,
translation.ja: 今日のゲストは AND1オールスターズだ

translation.en: I got the AND1 all-stars. I mean, y'all seen the mixtape.
translation.ja: 今日のゲストは AND1オールスターズだ ミックステープは見たか？

translation.en: You seen them balling out of control.
translation.ja: ミックステープは見たか？

translation.en: They gonna be doing their thing today. Go check them out.
translation.ja: 今日の試合を見逃すな

translation.en: [man] It's going down from 4:30 to 6:00.
translation.ja: ４時半から６時だ

translation.en: If you wanna become the next streetball player, come on down, this is your opportunity.
translation.ja: ストリート選手に なりたい人は必見だ

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] When we played in Atlanta, that atmosphere was totally different.
translation.ja: アトランタに着くと 空気が変わった

translation.en: [crowd] Hot Sauce! Hot Sauce!
translation.ja: ホットソース！ ホットソース！

translation.en: I can hear the crowd. The crowd is saying, "Hot Sauce."
translation.ja: ホットソースのコールだ

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] Yo, like, who is Hot Sauce?
translation.ja: “何者だ？”と思ったね “何者だ？”と思ったね ホットソース

translation.en: [Hot Sauce] I used to play in the hoods in Georgia, stealing balls out of other people's yards.
translation.ja: 昔は人の庭から ボールを盗んでプレーした

translation.en: I had a job, but I never could keep a job. My nine-to-five was just working on my handles.
translation.ja: 仕事が続かず 昼間は練習ばかりしてた

translation.en: I was already a local legend. Every day I played, people just circled around the court.
translation.ja: 俺は地元のレジェンドで コートには見物人が集まる

translation.en: [Hot Sauce] After seeing Mixtape 1 and Mixtape 2, I was hungry to be on the tapes.
translation.ja: ミックステープに 参加したいと思ったが

translation.en: But I didn't know what… what it would take.
translation.ja: 方法を知らなかった

translation.en: That's when I heard that they decided to take the tour to Atlanta.
translation.ja: そんな時 ツアーが来ると知ったんだ

translation.en: That's when my opportunity came.
translation.ja: チャンス到来だ

translation.en: I was in jail, you know, doing some of this knucklehead teenage stuff.
translation.ja: 当時 若気の至りで 刑務所にいたが

translation.en: But the day I got out of jail, the next day was a tour game.
translation.ja: 出所の翌日にツアーが来た

translation.en: It was like, "Yo. What is this?"
translation.ja: 驚いたね “あれは何だ？”と

translation.en: [Skip 2 My Lou] A lot of us are like, "What is he doing?"
translation.ja: みんなで目を見張ったよ

translation.en: It was… It was amazing.
translation.ja: すばらしかった

translation.en: When Hot Sauce did that… Oh baby!
translation.ja: ホットソースの技を見て ブッ飛んだ

translation.en: That was it.
translation.ja: 見事だ

translation.en: One man took the idea of streetball, and he just flipped it.
translation.ja: ストリートボールの概念を １人の男が ひっくり返した

translation.en: The flair and his image,
translation.ja: 彼の才能とイメージが すべてを変えたんだ

translation.en: it forever changed the game.
translation.ja: 彼の才能とイメージが すべてを変えたんだ 彼の才能とイメージが すべてを変えたんだ 〝ホットソース 大勢の観客を魅了〞

translation.en: [Jay] Volume 3 became "The Hot Sauce" tape.
translation.ja: 〝ホットソース 大勢の観客を魅了〞 ３作目は彼が主役だ

translation.en: We got the new star. It's done. This is all about this kid Hot Sauce.
translation.ja: 〝ホットソース 大勢の観客を魅了〞 “新たなスターがいた 彼で決まりだ”と契約した “新たなスターがいた 彼で決まりだ”と契約した

translation.en: So we signed him.
translation.ja: “新たなスターがいた 彼で決まりだ”と契約した

translation.en: [Gee Lock] From the first game on, he was like an icon.
translation.ja: １試合目から 彼は観客の憧れの的だ

translation.en: [Gee Lock] Once he came on the tour,
translation.ja: 彼が加わり——

translation.en: it was a whole nother animal.
translation.ja: すべてが変わった

translation.ja: 会社が選手を利用して—— 荒稼ぎしたと感じる人に 何と言いますか？

translation.en: built its wealth off the back of the players?
translation.ja: 荒稼ぎしたと感じる人に 何と言いますか？

translation.en: How would I respond
translation.ja: 会社が選手を利用して

translation.en: to somebody feeling like the players was exploited by the company?
translation.ja: 荒稼ぎしたと感じる人に 何と言うか？

translation.en: I would say, "I know the company was making a lot of money."
translation.ja: “会社が大金を稼いだのは 事実だ”と言うね

translation.en: After the games, you see the merchandise booth. Mad units with they faces on it, right?
translation.ja: 試合では選手グッズの販売で 多額の収益が得られる

translation.en: [man] We sold out again.
translation.ja: 売り切れです

translation.en: [Gee Lock] Players be like, "Yo. I ain't get paid for that."
translation.ja: 選手への分配はない

translation.en: It was the downfall of everything.
translation.ja: それが破綻の始まりだ

translation.en: [woman] We're at the warehouse. We receive, ship, and pack, uh, the AND1 product for everyone.
translation.ja: 私たちがAND1製品の荷受けや 梱包(こんぽう)をしているの

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] Up at 8:00 just to meet the people in the warehouse.
translation.ja: 倉庫の人に会うために 朝８時起きだ

translation.en: Courtesy. How many courtesy things are we gonna do?
translation.ja: お礼のあいさつは 何度やっただろうな

translation.en: This company was making millions and millions of dollars. But we the ones who make the money for y'all.
translation.ja: 会社は大金を稼いだ 全部 俺たちのおかげだ

translation.en: It started becoming a thing that we're gettin' pizza,
translation.ja: 選手にはピザが 配られるようになった

translation.en: but we go on a staff bus, they got everything.
translation.ja: だがスタッフのバスでは 贅沢(ぜいたく)三昧だ

translation.en: They got filet mignon, calamari, seltzer water, all the good shit.
translation.ja: ヒレ肉 イカ揚げ 炭酸水 すべて そろってた

translation.en: What are you eating, Shane?
translation.ja: それは？

translation.en: Before the game, uh, Buca shrimp parmesan.
translation.ja: 試合前の腹ごしらえだ イタリアンだよ

translation.en: [Chris] A lot of guys would say, "You got to take care of us." "Why are we not eating?" "Wouldn't be no tour if there were no players."
translation.ja: 選手から不満が噴出した ツアーの資本は俺たちだとね

translation.en: Because you're not wrong. Like, y'all should be eating, but you don't gotta be so aggressive with it.
translation.ja: 確かにそうだが 攻撃的になる必要はない

translation.en: [Headache] I'm throwing it… I'm throwing it on their bus.
translation.ja: ピザをブン投げてやる

translation.en: Uh-oh.
translation.ja: マズい

translation.en: [Duke] It's over now.
translation.ja: 覚悟しろ

translation.en: He throws a hot pizza on the tour manager's face!
translation.ja: ツアーマネージャーの顔に 熱いピザを投げつけたんだ

translation.en: [Headache] Tell her what I said. Tell her she got one more time. I'll smack the shit out of her. I'm dead serious.
translation.ja: あいつに伝えろ 次はボコボコにするとな

translation.en: [producer] How did you guys decide which players would be making a certain amount of money over others?
translation.ja: 選手の報酬額は あなたが決めたので？

translation.en: Not me. The only… The only conversation I ever got involved with
translation.ja: 僕じゃない ホットソースの代理人と 話したことはある

translation.en: was with Sauce and his agent.
translation.ja: ホットソースの代理人と 話したことはある

translation.en: It's my hometown. Still go down.
translation.ja: 地元に戻ってきた

translation.en: [Seth] He says, "Hey, Seth. You're a really nice guy."
translation.ja: 僕を“いい人だ”と

translation.en: I think to myself, "Yes, I am, motherfucker."
translation.ja: クソ野郎と思ったね

translation.en: He says, "Hey. Sauce wants this, or he's gonna go to Reebok."
translation.ja: “リーボックに移る”と 言ってきた

translation.en: I was like, "Let him go to Reebok, bro."
translation.ja: 〝好きにしろ〞 〝リーボック〞

translation.en: Reebok's gonna kill that dude's career. Nobody wants to be with Reebok.
translation.ja: あそこは 選手のキャリアを潰す

translation.en: It was interesting 'cause there really wasn't a pay structure.
translation.ja: 報酬体系はないも同然だった

translation.en: Main Event was like 90 to 100.
translation.ja: メインイベントは ９～10万ドル

translation.en: And AO was around that, 80 to 90.
translation.ja: ＡＯは８～９万ドル

translation.en: Half Man was between like 60 and 75.
translation.ja: ハーフマンは ６～７万５千ドル

translation.en: We had lower-tier guys that were getting like 15.
translation.ja: 下位選手たちは１万５千ドル

translation.en: But that's for three months of work. Because by the time September rolled around, there is no more tours.
translation.ja: 実質３カ月分の報酬だ ツアーは９月に終わる

translation.en: But we would judge guys on who got the most "oohs" and "ahs,"
translation.ja: 選手の評価は 歓声の大きさで決めた

translation.en: and obviously, Hot Sauce was the man.
translation.ja: １番はホットソースだ

translation.en: It was plenty of moments of dudes feeling frustrated,
translation.ja: 選手の不満は かなりの頻度で聞いた

translation.en: of not making enough money as somebody else was making.
translation.ja: “あいつより 報酬が少ない”とかね

translation.en: But on the AND1 tours, best to not tell nobody how much you getting,
translation.ja: 理想は自分の金額を 言わないことだが

translation.en: but they gonna say it because they like stunting on each other.
translation.ja: 比べたくて言ってしまう

translation.en: Let's go, baby.
translation.ja: 見せろ

translation.en: Dollars, dollars, dollars. Yeah.
translation.ja: 札束だぜ

translation.en: I had to get something new for 2005, you know. A little bling. A little something.
translation.ja: 2005年の自分に ご褒美を買った

translation.en: This is Sizzle's crib. You know what I'm saying?
translation.ja: ここは俺の家だ

translation.en: This… this is my second crib. I got two cribs, whatever.
translation.ja: 俺には自宅が２つある

translation.en: I remember Hot Sauce had a car that could talk.
translation.ja: “話す車”も持ってた

translation.en: [car] Greetings, Hot Sauce.
translation.ja: ようこそ ホットソース

translation.en: [laughing] People hated that shit.
translation.ja: 最悪だったよ

translation.en: I tried to never get into any money talks.
translation.ja: 金額交渉は避けた

translation.en: I knew that I was sort of the new guy, and I had a lot of marketability,
translation.ja: 俺は新参者だし市場性も高い

translation.en: and I felt like my salary was great.
translation.ja: 報酬額には満足していた

translation.en: [director] And action.
translation.ja: アクション

translation.en: There was definitely a little jealousy rolling around
translation.ja: 選手間の嫉妬は確かにあった

translation.en: from players being promoted more than others.
translation.ja: 評価の高い選手に対するね

translation.en: [AO] You see cats.
translation.ja: 胸クソ悪い

translation.en: They had one or two big games. They are "streetball legends."
translation.ja: 数回 試合に出ただけで レジェンド気取りだ

translation.en: We was grinding like… nine, ten years
translation.ja: 俺はチームが 無名の頃から

translation.en: before we even knew what AND1 was.
translation.ja: ９～10年もやってる

translation.en: [Headache] Oh man, don't get me wrong. Professor's a heck of a basketball player,
translation.ja: プロフェッサーの腕は 認めるが

translation.en: but, um, I question sometimes his motive.
translation.ja: 動機には疑問を感じる

translation.en: [The Professor] It doesn't really bother me. I mean,
translation.ja: あまり気にならない

translation.en: as long as we're out on tour having fun, I really don't care what they think. Honestly.
translation.ja: ツアーを楽しめれば どう思われてもいい

translation.en: The rock star started getting into everybody's head. And everybody started thinking about the money.
translation.ja: スター意識が芽生えて 報酬額が気になりだした

translation.en: You… You stop acting like that, man. Damn, man, fuck!
translation.ja: そういう態度はやめろ

translation.en: [man] How you figure that?
translation.ja: 何だ？

translation.en: Where you getting the check from?
translation.ja: 雇い主は誰だ？

translation.en: If I wasn't here, I'd be out playing and making money.
translation.ja: 仕事をしただけだ 悪いかよ

translation.en: This tour? It's breaking me. I'm not making money.
translation.ja: ツアーじゃ稼げねえよ

translation.en: My contract ain't shit, man. I'm telling y'all niggas. It ain't shit, yo! It ain't shit!
translation.ja: 言っとくが俺の契約は クソも同然だ

translation.en: I'm eating off this. I'm making plenty of money.
translation.ja: 俺は十分に稼いでる

translation.en: I don't know about you, man. My living expenses ain't like yours. You live in luxury, nigga. You live in luxury. I'm still living in the projects, nigga!
translation.ja: お前らのような贅沢(ぜいたく)はしない 今も公団住宅に住んでるんだ

translation.en: We got too many all-stars.
translation.ja: スターが多すぎる

translation.en: When you create a monster, you gotta know how to tame a monster.
translation.ja: モンスターを作るなら 手なずけろ

translation.en: The animosity against each other boiled up to a point where it was becoming bigger and bigger and bigger.
translation.ja: 仲間への敵意が 次第に大きくなっていった

translation.en: -Why you don't ask me? -'Cause I'm not-- [bleep]
translation.ja: 聞けよ 断る

translation.en: Why not? I ask the coach a question!
translation.ja: なぜ質問に答えない？

translation.en: -[man] That's why. -[Hot Sauce] I don't disrespect you.
translation.ja: コーチだからだ

translation.en: -[Ziggy] I'm not talking to you! -Eat a dick! Eat a dick, nigga!
translation.ja: 黙ってろ うるさい　クソ野郎

translation.en: I ain't trying to hear that shit, man!
translation.ja: やめろよ

translation.en: -Who's a bitch, Zig? Who? -[Ziggy] You!
translation.ja: もう１回言ってみろ

translation.en: [man] Bro, don't get this shit. We look like clowns.
translation.ja: 撮るな　レベルが低すぎる

translation.en: That shit's getting crazy.
translation.ja: 大騒ぎだ

translation.en: [man 2] Yo, why y'all grabbing me? Why you grabbing me, though, man?
translation.ja: なんで俺を止める？ 俺は悪くない

translation.en: [Tom] When I took over footwear, we had a phenomenal business success.
translation.ja: ２００５年 ２００５年 僕の手がけるシューズが 売上の９割を占め—— 僕の手がけるシューズが 売上の９割を占め——

translation.en: We were doing 90% of the sales.
translation.ja: 僕の手がけるシューズが 売上の９割を占め——

translation.en: At that point, I felt like the whole company was on my shoulders to a degree.
translation.ja: 会社を背負う重圧を感じた

translation.en: [Jay] So Tom decided to move over to Taiwan
translation.ja: トムは台湾に引っ越した

translation.en: because he could influence the quality of the product much better
translation.ja: 外からの刺激を 品質に反映できる 開発部にいるよりもずっとね

translation.en: sitting there at the factory.
translation.ja: 開発部にいるよりもずっとね

translation.en: I was worried because Tom's an incredibly hard worker.
translation.ja: 彼の働き方を案じた

translation.en: I probably worked 364 days a year on average.
translation.ja: 恐らく１年のうち 364日は働いていた

translation.en: I just lived in, like, airports and hotels,
translation.ja: 空港やホテルで寝泊まりし

translation.en: switching 12 time zones every six weeks.
translation.ja: ６週間ごとに タイムゾーンを変える

translation.en: Without me realizing it, it became too much.
translation.ja: 気づかずに無理をしてた

translation.en: Ended up getting diagnosed with a digestive disorder.
translation.ja: 消化器系の病気を患い

translation.en: I lost like 20 or 30 pounds.
translation.ja: 10キロほど痩せた

translation.en: I remember Seth and Jay called me at 2:00, 3:00 in the morning Asian time.
translation.ja: 現地の夜中３時に セスから電話があった時

translation.en: "How's it going? What's next?" And I just lost it.
translation.ja: 現地の夜中３時に セスから電話があった時 僕は冷静さを失った

translation.en: "That's it. I am sick of you chirping at me." "I'm doing what I'm doing. You know, you guys can't do this."
translation.ja: “催促されるのは うんざりだ”と言って

translation.en: And I hung up.
translation.ja: 電話を切った

translation.en: I know Tom did feel some pressures from outside, and particularly from me as the person to whom he directly reported.
translation.ja: 外的圧力は感じていたはずだ 特に僕からのね

translation.en: I kind of ended up pulling back into my own little shell.
translation.ja: 僕は再び心を閉ざし——

translation.en: I lost friendships during that time.
translation.ja: 友人も失った

translation.en: I just ended up a mess, physically and emotionally.
translation.ja: 心身共に疲れ切ったんだ

translation.en: For the first time in my life, it wasn't fun. It wasn't always easy, but it had always been fun.
translation.ja: 楽しいはずの仕事が 初めて苦痛に感じた

translation.en: [Seth] So Tom comes into my office.
translation.ja: 彼はオフィスに来て言った

translation.en: He says, "Seth, I'm resigning."
translation.ja: 彼はオフィスに来て言った “俺は辞める”と

translation.en: I'm like, "Wait. What?" Like, that's impossible.
translation.ja: “何だって？”　寝耳に水だ

translation.en: [Jay] After Tom left us, we cratered.
translation.ja: トムの退職で売上は急落 トムの退職で売上は急落 〝トム退職〞 トムの退職で売上は急落

translation.en: We went from over 200 million in sales to, you know, 130. I had to lay off 20% of the staff.
translation.ja: ２億ドルから1.3億になり ２割の従業員を解雇した

translation.en: We knew we only had a small window to sell the company in order to maximize the financial value.
translation.ja: ただ 短期間で会社を売れば 財務価値を最大化できた

translation.en: [Duke] Paoli, Pennsylvania.
translation.ja: ペンシルベニア州パオリ

translation.en: The 2005 minicamp. Mixtape Tour!
translation.ja: ミックステープツアー 2005 ミニキャンプだ

translation.en: AO!
translation.ja: ＡＯ！

translation.en: [The Professor] I just got word from the people at AND1 that we're to be on the cover of Sports Illustrated.
translation.ja: スポーツ誌の表紙を 飾ることになった

translation.en: Growing up, to be on Sports Illustrated, it's like the king of sports magazines.
translation.ja: 小さい頃から 憧れていた雑誌だ

translation.en: It's going down. It's official.
translation.ja: 本当に発売された

translation.en: Right. We gotta frame this right here.
translation.ja: 額に入れよう

translation.en: [The Professor] Before the beginning of the 2005 tour,
translation.ja: 〝ＡＮＤ１が 革命を起こした軌跡〞 2005年ツアーの直前——

translation.en: we didn't get a call right away to renew our contracts. So it was confusing.
translation.ja: 会社から 契約更新の連絡がなかった

translation.en: We was just frustrated with the way everything was going on.
translation.ja: みんな 現状にイラ立ってた

translation.en: So many stories has been going around.
translation.ja: いろいろな憶測が流れた

translation.en: [The Professor] All of a sudden, the staff rounded us up in a room.
translation.ja: 突然 スタッフに囲まれ…

translation.en: So I'm like, "Heck is going on here?" He's like, "Yo, just chill."
translation.ja: “落ち着いて聞け”

translation.en: [The Professor] And they told us, "Hey. There's going to be a major buy-out, and things aren't gonna be the same."
translation.ja: “会社が買収される すべてが変わるぞ”と

translation.en: It was unexpected.
translation.ja: 突然だ

translation.en: It was gone. That was it.
translation.ja: すべてが消えた

translation.en: No notice.
translation.ja: 予告なしだ

translation.en: No notice.
translation.ja: 予告なし

translation.en: The players are so prideful
translation.ja: 選手はプライドが高い

translation.en: that I don't think they will ever tell you that they felt down.
translation.ja: 選手はプライドが高い 落胆を口には出さないだろう

translation.en: At the end of the day, we mint. But I think about the audacity for them
translation.ja: 異論はない だが選手に黙って決めたのは 尊大だと思う

translation.en: not sitting with none of the legends when that shit ended.
translation.ja: だが選手に黙って決めたのは 尊大だと思う

translation.en: It should be a success story.
translation.ja: 成功でもある

translation.en: AND1 was huge. We created something from nothing.
translation.ja: ゼロから大企業に成長させた

translation.en: We sold the business, and we all made a lot of money,
translation.ja: 事業を売り 大金を得た

translation.en: but the sale, in the end, was so hard for me physically, and then it was also just, like, really sad.
translation.ja: だが体力的にはハードで 悲しくもあった

translation.en: There was infighting and some fracturing of relationships,
translation.ja: 内輪モメもあったし 壊れた人間関係もある

translation.en: and emotionally it's still, like, bittersweet.
translation.ja: 気持ち的には ほろ苦い

translation.en: Definitely.
translation.ja: 確実にね

translation.en: [announcer] You may recognize his face from ESPN Streetball!
translation.ja: ご存じ ＥＳＰＮの 「ストリートボール」より

translation.en: -Shane "The Dribble Machine" Woney! -[crowd cheering, applauding]
translation.ja: シェイン“ドリブルマシン” ウォニー！

translation.en: Court Jesters is a semi-pro league version of the… of the Harlem Globetrotters.
translation.ja: 〝コート･ジェスターズ〞 〝コート･ジェスターズ〞 コート･ジェスターズは ハーレム･ グローブトロッターズの セミプロ版だ

translation.en: This… This ain't like the Garden. Nothing like the Garden, baby.
translation.ja: マディソン･スクエア･ ガーデンとは違う

translation.en: I may see a guy that recognizes me, and they ask me a question like, "What you doing working here, man? You was on TV."
translation.ja: 周りに よく言われた “有名人がここで何を？”と

translation.en: That right there is a heartbreaker.
translation.ja: それがつらかった

translation.en: Every day I wake up saying, "Man. I hope something happens
translation.ja: 毎朝 思ったよ “奇跡が起きて １日でも プレーに呼ばれたい”と

translation.en: where they say, 'You know what? Shane, we need you just for today.'"
translation.ja: “奇跡が起きて １日でも プレーに呼ばれたい”と

translation.en: This is what I think.
translation.ja: こう考えよう

translation.en: We didn't get paid what we was worth.
translation.ja: “報酬が俺たちの価値に 見合わなかった”

translation.en: How about that? How about that? Our worth.
translation.ja: “報酬が俺たちの価値に 見合わなかった” 俺たちの価値だ

translation.en: They came to the hood and took everything.
translation.ja: すべてを奪われた

translation.en: The hood gives them their opinions or whatever, "Y'all should do this." They run right upstairs and do it,
translation.ja: 俺たちからアイデアを奪い 会社は荒稼ぎした

translation.en: and then they sell it and don't give nothing back.
translation.ja: だが見返りはない

translation.en: Like I always said. It's called "Poverty Pimping."
translation.ja: 貧困層が食い物にされた

translation.en: People say, "Well, corporate America is trying to take advantage of you and make money."
translation.ja: “選手を利用して 会社が荒稼ぎした”

translation.en: That's what the outside world perceives, and being on the inside, that wasn't the case.
translation.ja: それが世間の見方だったが 実際は違う

translation.en: We were trying to catch lightning in a bottle and do something cool.
translation.ja: 僕らは奇跡を信じて努力した

translation.en: If we're guilty of anything, it was that.
translation.ja: それだけだ

translation.en: The contracts that we signed with them weren't insignificant.
translation.ja: 契約金額は決して低くない

translation.en: We paid some of the Mixtape players more than we paid other NBA players.
translation.ja: ＮＢＡ選手より 多い選手もいた

translation.en: They signed us to a contract, now it's up to us to agree to that number.
translation.ja: 契約はもらった あとは金額に納得するだけだ

translation.en: We don't have to agree to that number.
translation.ja: 断ってもいい

translation.en: The money they offered me? Heck yeah, I'm gonna take it.
translation.ja: 報酬額？　受け入れたさ

translation.en: I don't care what y'all got to say about it. "Oh, you're not loyal. Shit is…" Loyal to what?
translation.ja: 裏切りだと 後ろ指をさされてもいい

translation.en: That loyalty ain't gonna give me no check. I know that.
translation.ja: 誠実でいても稼げない

translation.en: Did they love us for what we did? Yeah. But did they respect us?
translation.ja: プレーは認めてくれたが 俺たちへの敬意は？

translation.en: Answer me that.
translation.ja: 答えてみろ

translation.en: [Jay] One of my biggest regrets.
translation.ja: 最大の後悔は——

translation.en: Had we thought of the Mixtape players like employees as opposed to endorsed athletes,
translation.ja: 選手をアスリートではなく 従業員として扱ったことだ

translation.en: then we could have given them some stock options.
translation.ja: 自社株を 購入できれば——

translation.en: And that would have resulted in some incremental wealth going to all those players.
translation.ja: 全選手がそれぞれに 資産を増やせたはずだ

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] Our lives didn't matter to them.
translation.ja: 俺たちを軽んじた

translation.en: -I think it's a-- I think it's a… -Our lives didn't matter, man.
translation.ja: 軽んじた

translation.en: -Main. Our lives… My man… -Maybe.
translation.ja: いいか　俺たちを…

translation.en: I… Listen, listen, listen.
translation.ja: よく聞け

translation.en: My last final year with AND1,
translation.ja: AND1での最後の年

translation.en: I asked that man for $16,000 to put my son in school for a contract,
translation.ja: 俺は１万６千ドルで 契約してくれと頼んだ 息子の学費のためだ

translation.en: and then they told me, "I cannot help you." After all that shit we did.
